location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter to Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Iman of Muscat

mods.abstract: The letter explains that while the author is not yet satisfied with the explanation for the motives behind the previous expedition, in order to restore the reputation of 'British arms' they will work with the Imam against the Beni Boo Ullee [Banī Bū ‘Alī] tribe.The author is not known, but it is likely to be Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay. The letter is also undated, but the content and surrounding correspondence suggests an approximate date of around December 1811.
